articles.headline: Training Afghans as Bullets Fly
articles.snippet: A firebase, where two young Marines train Afghan soldiers, offers a fine-grained glimpse inside the war.
articles.abstract: A firebase, where two young Marines train Afghan soldiers, offers a fine-grained glimpse inside the war.
articles.lead_paragraph: FIREBASE VIMOTO, Afghanistan — Three stone houses and a cluster of sandbagged bunkers cling to a slope above the Korangal Valley, forming an oval perimeter roughly 75 yards long. The oval is reinforced with timber and ringed with concertina wire.

articles.headline: Iranians and Others Outwit Net Censors
articles.snippet: Computers are becoming more crucial in global conflicts, not only in spying and military action, but also in determining what information reaches people.
articles.abstract: Computers are becoming more crucial in global conflicts, not only in spying and military action, but also in determining what information reaches people.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Iranian government, more than almost any other, censors what citizens can read online, using elaborate technology to block millions of Web sites offering news, commentary, videos, music and, until recently, Facebook and YouTube. Search for “women” in Persian and you’re told, “Dear Subscriber, access to this site is not possible.”

articles.headline: Goodbye to Naked Shorting
articles.snippet: Investors have sent letters to the government complaining that naked short-selling has hurt share prices.
articles.abstract: Investors have sent letters to the government complaining that naked short-selling has hurt share prices.

articles.headline: The Lenders Obama Decided to Blame
articles.snippet: Chrysler lenders who wanted a better offer, who President Obama called “speculators,” will now take whatever this bankruptcy brings.
articles.abstract: Chrysler lenders who wanted a better offer, who President Obama called “speculators,” will now take whatever this bankruptcy brings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Peter A. Weinberg and Joseph R. Perella are part of a band of Wall Street renegades  “a small group of speculators,” President Obama called them Thursday  who helped bankrupt Chrysler.

articles.headline: Chrysler Partners Have Many Goals
articles.snippet: Chrysler’s biggest challenge may be persuading its three principal new owners to innovate in ways the carmaker has resisted for three decades.
articles.abstract: Chrysler’s biggest challenge may be persuading its three principal new owners to innovate in ways the carmaker has resisted for three decades.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Before Chrysler can start building cars that more Americans want to buy, it will have to overcome considerable challenges.

articles.headline: Souter Said to Be Leaving Court in June
articles.snippet: Justice David H. Souter has grown increasingly sour on Washington and intends to return to his home state at the end of the Supreme Court’s term, according to people briefed on his plans.
articles.abstract: Justice David H. Souter has grown increasingly sour on Washington and intends to return to his home state at the end of the Supreme Court’s term, according to people briefed on his plans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Justice David H. Souter plans to retire at the end of the term in June, giving President Obama his first appointment to the Supreme Court, four people informed about the decision said Thursday night.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Jeff Zeleny
